summary: This is an FBI memorandum of interview with a witness, identified as (M), conducted on September 10, 2019. The witness discusses her long-term professional and personal relationship with an individual referred to as (a), providing insights into his business dealings, personality, and relationships, including details about the Palm House Hotel transaction, a Nantucket property, and an encounter with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: (M)
persons.context: The primary interviewee. She is a long-time friend and business associate of (a), having worked for him since approximately 2007. She discusses his business deals, personality, and relationships.

persons.name: Tamara Gerber
persons.context: A friend of (M) through whom she met (a) around 2007.

persons.name: (a)
persons.context: The central figure discussed in the interview. Described as a businessman with potential medical conditions (Asperger's, Dyslexia), a sociopath, and someone easily swayed by attractive women. Involved in various real estate deals like the Palm House Hotel.

persons.name: Don Langdon
persons.context: Contacted (M) to inform her that (a) was about to lose the Palm House Hotel in 2009.

persons.name: Mia
persons.context: Wife of an individual referred to as (a2). (a) was infatuated with her, loaned her money, and she used a loan to save a Nantucket house from foreclosure.

persons.name: (a2)
persons.context: An individual involved with Mia in the Palm House Hotel deal whom (M) investigated, advising (a) not to lend him money.

persons.name: Ryan Black
persons.context: Filed paperwork that revealed a delayed lien filing on the Palm House Hotel. Later met with (a) and (M) to discuss improprieties at the hotel.

persons.name: Craig Galle
persons.context: (a)'s attorney who was confronted about the delayed lien filing on the Palm House Hotel. Described as a good litigator but not exceptionally intelligent. (a) has traveled with him.

persons.name: Les Evans
persons.context: Identified as the closing agent responsible for filing the lien on the Palm House Hotel.

persons.name: John Voloshin
persons.context: Convinced (a) to let him handle the bidding process for a Nantucket hotel and subsequently stole (a)'s auction fee.

persons.name: Keith Mahler
persons.context: Name appeared on documents relating to the 59 Elm Street property in New Haven. (a) stated he would need to 'get Mahler out of the way' to acquire the property.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Attempted to come onto (a)'s yacht in Palm Beach with a 14-year-old Russian girl. (M) told him to leave. This was the only time she saw him.

persons.name: Jessica Nicodemo
persons.context: Identified as one of the women (a) dated. Described as the only one who did not date him for his money and who wanted to marry him.

persons.name: Tiffany Richtmeyer
persons.context: Identified as a friend of (a) and one of the women he dated. Described as a nice girl but 'a bit messed up'.

persons.name: Joe Walsh
persons.context: Met with (a), (M), and Ryan Black at Ruth Chris steakhouse to discuss improprieties at the Palm House Hotel.

persons.name: Jim Everett
persons.context: Possibly the step-father of (M). He entered the house during the interview, causing a brief pause.

persons.name: Stephen M.
persons.context: The FBI Special Agent who prepared the memorandum of interview on September 16-17, 2019.

connections.description: (M) has worked for (a) since approximately 2007, usually as a sub-contractor, and was briefly on his Polo Club payroll. She also considers him a friend.
Tamara Gerber is a friend of (M) and the person through whom she met (a).
(a) was infatuated with Mia and loaned her money, which she used to save a Nantucket house from foreclosure. He sought companionship from her.
Craig Galle is (a)'s attorney. (a) has traveled with him at Galle's request.
Epstein approached (a)'s yacht in Palm Beach. (M) told Epstein to leave, indicating a brief, unwelcome encounter.
Jessica Nicodemo is identified as a former girlfriend of (a). (M) states she was the only one not dating him for his money.
Black filed paperwork revealing issues with the Palm House Hotel lien and later met with (a) to discuss hotel improprieties.
Voloshin convinced (a) to let him handle a hotel auction and then stole (a)'s auction fee.

events.title: Palm House Hotel Deal
events.description: (a) purchased the note on the Palm House Hotel (PHH) after being advised not to lend money to (a2) and Mia. A lien on the property was not filed until 6 months after closing.

events.title: Nantucket Hotel Auction Scheme
events.description: (a) planned to bid on a hotel in Nantucket, MA, but his auction fee was stolen by John Voloshin, who had convinced (a) to let him handle the bidding. (a) was subsequently not registered to bid.

events.title: Onset of (a)'s Health Decline
events.description: (M) first noticed (a)'s health deteriorating in 2013, describing him as experiencing 'voids' and seeing doctors.

events.title: Scheduled Testimony Subpoena
events.description: (M) was served with a subpoena to testify in New Haven, CT on September 26, 2019, at the conclusion of this interview.

events.title: Encounter with Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attempted to board (a)'s yacht in Palm Beach while it was docked next to Epstein's yacht. Epstein was with a 14-year-old Russian girl. (M) told Epstein to leave.

keyFacts: The witness (M) describes a direct encounter where Jeffrey Epstein attempted to board (a)'s yacht in Palm Beach with a 14-year-old Russian girl, and she told him to leave.
(M) states that (a) has significant business dealings in real estate, including the problematic Palm House Hotel transaction where a lien filing was delayed by 6 months.
The witness provides a psychological profile of (a), suggesting he has Asperger's, Dyslexia, is a 'sociopath', is easily swayed by attractive women, and fears abandonment.
(M) claims no knowledge or involvement in filing liens on various women, hinting at a pattern of behavior by (a) or his associates.
The interview was conducted as part of a criminal investigation, and (M) was subpoenaed to testify in New Haven, CT later in September 2019.
